Description: Terracotta figure of a laden camel. The head fragment only, broken at neck. Mould-made and hollow. Traces of black paint. Light yellow-brown (marl?), dense clay with some mica and quartz inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Labelled 'no. 337', the number Gutch published this example as, but also labelled '73', possibly a location number (Hogarth 1899, no. 337, p. 96). A small number of camel figures were found at Naukratis, all from different mould series (Brussels, Musées Royaux d’Art et d’Histoire A.1834; Boston, Museum of Fine Arts 88.927; 88.1029; Cambridge, Fitzwilliam Museum GR.6.1899; Gutch 1899, 96, no. 337). Camel figures are usually dated to the Roman period, with a number of parallels from Egypt (Kaufmann 1915, Fig.116; Fischer 1994, no.1115, see also 1116; Dunand 1990, nos. 831). Parallels from Egypt and Libya dated 1st to 4th century AD (Louvre, Paris AE, E 27425; AO 7437; AO 10223). Dunand, F. 1990. Catalogue des Terres cuites gréco-romaines d’Egypte. Musée du louvre. Musée du Louvre. Département des antiquités égyptiennes. Paris. Fischer, J. 1994, Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber, Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen, Tübinger Studien zur Archäologie und Kunstgeschichte 14, Tübingen. Wasmuth. Kaufmann, C. M. 1915, Greco-ägyptische Koroplastik. Terrakotten der griechisch-römischen und koptischen Epoche aus der Faijûm-Oase und andren Fundstätten, Cairo.
Bibliographic references: Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 96, no. 337)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.283) (Phase 3)
